feed.title: Google Cloud: Dataplex
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Dataplex

entry.content: Semantic search in Dataplex Universal Catalog is available in preview. Semantic search extends keyword search to support natural language queries. It lets you find resources using everyday language, eliminating the need for complex syntax.
entry.summary: Dataplex Universal Catalog now offers semantic search in preview. This feature allows you to use natural language queries to find resources, making search more intuitive and accessible.
entry.title: Feature: Semantic Search Now in Preview

entry.content:
Previously, data quality scan results were published only to the Google Cloud console. You can now publish the results of a data quality scan as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata. The latest results are saved to the entry that represents the source table. You can view the results in the Google Cloud console.

If you want to enable catalog publishing for an existing data quality scan, you must edit the scan and re-enable the publishing option.

For more information, see Use auto data quality.

This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Data quality scan results can now be published as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata, with the latest results saved to the entry representing the source table. To enable this for existing scans, edit the scan and re-enable the publishing option. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Data quality scan results now available in Dataplex Universal Catalog
